alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Jackson; Lincoln; Mason; Mingo; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 11:56PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Lawrence, southern Gallia, southern Mason, Cabell, northwestern Mingo, Putnam, Lincoln, central Jackson and Wayne Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1155 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Buffalo to near Beech Fork State Park to near Job. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Wayne, Hamlin, Hurricane, Barboursville, Milton, Eleanor, Buffalo, Ranger, Ona, Culloden, Harts, Gill, East Lynn Lake, Kiahsville, Dunlow, Teays Valley, West Hamlin, Bancroft and Crum. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 16 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Cabell; Jackson; Lincoln; Mason; Mingo; Putnam; Wayne
